key_points: Marine Cpl. Daegan Page, killed in Kabul airport attack, will be honored at Omaha Lancers hockey game.
The attack occurred on Aug. 26 at Hamid Karzai International Airport, Kabul, Afghanistan.
Page was among the 13 service members who lost their lives in the attack.
He was a part of the 2nd Battalion, 1st Marine Regiment, 1st Marine Expeditionary Force at Camp Pendleton, California.
Visiting Angels chose the Page family for their Hometown Hero Seat during the game against the Sioux Falls Stampede.
Page's love for hockey inspired the selection; his mother says he would have loved the event.
The Hometown Hero Seat acknowledges military members, first responders, or their family members.
Page's family will participate in a ceremonial puck-drop and receive a Lancers sweater in his honor.
The event helps Page's family feel supported and remembered by their community.
A media Q&A session with the Page family will follow the puck-drop ceremony and gift presentation.
